title: What is the difference between a cheap and an expensive digital piano? - Quora

response.answer_text: I got kicked out of a band once because I said in a group text once that "the keyboard player should quit buying his keyboards at Radio Shack" and didn't realize that the keyboard player was in the group. Several things. Better quality instruments are built more sturdily. They're heavier because they're better. They won't bust the first time they're dropped or tossed out of a van. The touch is better on a quality instrument. Cheapo keyboards have cheapo keys made of plastic. A lot of cheap keyboards have gimmicky features. Blinking lights Pro keyboards are more functional. Sound? I'm not sure there's that much difference. A digital circuit is a digital circuit. It's not much more expensive to make a quality digital circuit.

The same as anything else - the cheaper one will contain cheaper components, cheaper materials, the synth that generates the sounds will likely be inferior. A good keyboard is going to have weighted keys for a more piano-like feel. If it has a built in amplifier and speakers, those would also likely be inferior on the cheaper models. Depending on your needs, cheaper might be fine. If you are not a performing musician, a difference in reliability or diminished sound quality may not be an issue for you.
